links.*: England and Always: Tolkien's World of the Rings

wikitext.*:
'''Tolkien's World''', other than his [[legendarium]] or the mythology of [[Arda]] and [[Middle-earth]], may refer to six different books:
* ''[[England and Always: Tolkien's World of the Rings]]'', a [[1981]] book by [[Jared Lobdell]].
* ''[[A Tolkien Bestiary]]'', a [[1979]] book by David Day, appeared in some prints as ''Guide to Tolkien's World: A Bestiary''.
* ''[[Tolkien's World (by Randel Helms)|Tolkien's World]]'', a [[1974]] book by [[Randel Helms]].
* ''[[Tolkien's World: Paintings of Middle-earth]]'', a [[1992]] collection of paintings by (among others) [[Inger Edelfeldt]], [[John Howe]], [[Roger Garland]] and [[Michael Hague]].
* ''[[The World of Tolkien]]'', a [[2004]] book also by [[David Day]], appeared in some prints as ''Tolkien's World''.
* ''мир Толкина'' ("Tolkien's World"), a Russian pirate translation of parts of ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'' and ''[[The Complete Guide to Middle-earth]]'', by [[Nadezhda Chertkov]].
* ''[[Tolkien's World (by Gareth Hanrahan)|Tolkien's World: A Guide to the Peoples and Places of Middle-Earth]]'', a [[2012]] guide book by Gareth Hanrahan and Peter McKinstry.
*''[[Tolkien's World: A Colouring Book]]''
{{disambig}}
